revisions.rev:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''EastEnders: E20'' characters}} [[File:EastEnders E20 series 2 cast.jpg|thumb|250px|alt=Naz, a woman of Turkish ethnicity, has heavy make-up on her face. She is wearing a short, leopard print skirt, low-cut black top and a black jacket. Standing next to her is Sol, a black man wearing a blue jacket and blue jeans, with his hands in his pockets. Another black man, Asher, is next to Sol, and wears a purple shirt with the top few buttons open. Finally, Stevie is next to Asher. She has blonde hair in curls, and is wearing a light, flowery dress and a headband with a large pink flower on it. |The main characters from series 2: [[Naz Mehmet]] (Emaa Hussen), [[Sol Levi]] ([[Tosin Cole]]), [[Asher Levi]] ([[Heshima Thompson]]) and [[Stevie Dickinson]] (Amanda Fairbank-Hynes).]]
''[[EastEnders: E20]]'' is a British [[Internet]] [[teen drama|teen]] [[soap opera]], available on [[BBC Online]], the official website of the [[BBC]]. The series is a spin-off from the long-running soap opera ''[[EastEnders]]'' and was created by [[Diederick Santer]]. The series is set in [[Walford]], a fictional borough of London, and follows the stories of teenagers who arrive in an attempt to escape from various problems.
For series 1, open auditions were held at [[Theatre Royal Stratford East]], followed by recalls until the possible actors were reduced to eight and then four.<ref name="understand2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=57w_XyMfv2M|title=The making of an online drama â part 2|publisher=[[BBC]]|format=video|accessdate=15 January 2010}}</ref> The first series follows the characters of [[Zsa Zsa Carter]] ([[Emer Kenny]]), [[Fatboy (EastEnders)|Fatboy]] ([[Ricky Norwood]]), [[Mercy Olubunmi]] ([[Bunmi Mojekwu]]) and [[Leon Small]] ([[Sam Attwater]]), who meet in the first episode and decide to squat together in a flat at 89b George Street. Leon, Fatboy and Zsa Zsa also appeared briefly in ''EastEnders'' in January 2010 before ''EastEnders: E20'' started,<ref name="cast">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a188405/eastenders-announces-e20-cast.html|title='EastEnders' announces 'E20' cast|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=25 November 2009|accessdate=25 November 2009}}</ref> and returned as regular characters when ''EastEnders: E20'' ended.<ref name="soaplife">{{cite journal |last=Swift |first=Simon |date=9 January 2010 |title=Meet Walford's new wild child... |journal=[[Soaplife]] |issue= 215 |page=page 27 |publisher=[[IPC Media]] |accessdate=9 January 2010 }}</ref> It was since announced that due to positive reaction to the character, Mercy would also join ''EastEnders'' later in 2010.<ref name="mercysigns">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a198754/e20s-mercy-signs-as-enders-regular.html|title='E20's Mercy signs as 'Enders regular|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=24 January 2010|accessdate=24 January 2010}}</ref>
The second series follows four new characters, [[Asher Levi]] ([[Heshima Thompson]]) and his brother [[Sol Levi|Sol]] ([[Tosin Cole]]), [[Naz Mehmet]] (Emaa Hussen), and [[Stevie Dickinson]] (Amanda Fairbank-Hynes), who move into the flat above the beauty salon at 10 Turpin Road.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s86/eastenders-e20/news/a213085/bbc-hands-eastenders-e20-second-run.html|title=BBC hands 'EastEnders: E20' second run|last=Green|first=Kris|date=8 April 2010|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=29 July 2010|location=London}}</ref><ref name="series 2 cast" /> The third series follows Mercy's sister [[Faith Olubunmi]] (Modupe Adeyeye), [[Donnie Lester]] ([[Samuell Benta]]) and [[Ava Bourne]] (Sophie Colquhoun).<ref name="meet the cast"/> Faith also appears in ''EastEnders'' for a short period before the start of the series. The three begin squatting in 3 Albert Square.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s86/eastenders-e20/spoilers/a340012/the-trio-target-albert-squares-residents.html|title=The trio target Albert Square's residents|work=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Daniel|last=Kilkelly|date=22 September 2011|accessdate=15 October 2011}}</ref> Additionally, many ''EastEnders'' characters make cameo appearances in all three series.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a183148/eastenders-launches-online-soap-e20.html|title='EastEnders' launches online soap 'E20'|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=22 October 2009|accessdate=24 October 2009}}</ref>
==Main characters== ===Series 1=== *'''[[Zsa Zsa Carter]]''' is portrayed by '''[[Emer Kenny]]'''. She is the blue-haired niece of regular ''EastEnders'' character [[Shirley Carter]] ([[Linda Henry]]). She is a beautiful, funky and outspoken tomboy who is very bright, but does not like to accept anyone's help.<ref name="cast2">{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/news/091125-meet-e20.shtml|title=Meet the E20 cast!|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|date=25 November 2009|accessdate=17 December 2009}}</ref> She has a dislike of authority and does not care about other people.<ref name="soaplife"/> Zsa Zsa is similar to Shirley, though the writers said they did not plan this. The character changed greatly during the writing process and the writers were unsure who she was until filming started.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/scoop/a195894/a-quick-chat-with-zsa-zsa-from-enders-e20.html|title=A quick chat with Zsa Zsa from 'Enders: E20'|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=15 January 2010|accessdate=15 January 2010}}</ref> She makes a cameo appearance in episode 1 of series 2 and is a regular character in ''EastEnders'' between January and September 2010.
*'''[[Fatboy (EastEnders)|Fatboy]]''' is portrayed by '''[[Ricky Norwood]]'''. He avoids being his real self by creating personas for himself, as he dislikes his real name and puts on a mask with his current and most sustained persona, Fatboy, a brash [[wikt:wheeler-dealer|wheeler-dealer]]. He uses a lot of street slang, gets on well with his parents and gets what he wants from them.<ref name="cast2"/><ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/pressoffice/pressreleases/stories/2010/01_january/08/e202.shtml|title=EastEnders: E20 â interview with Ricky Norwood|publisher=BBC Press Office|date=8 January 2010|accessdate=19 February 2010}}</ref> Fatboy also appears as a recurring character in series 2 of ''EastEnders: E20'', and is one of four characters from the second series to have an official account on social networking site [[Twitter]].<ref name="DSTweets">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s86/eastenders-e20/scoop/a259792/e20-update-the-characters-join-twitter.html|title='E20' update: The characters join Twitter!|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=11 August 2010|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=11 August 2010|location=London}}</ref> He also appears in series 3.<ref name="series 3 behind scenes">{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/eastenders/2011/06/e20-series-3-first-behind-the-.shtml|title=E20 series 3: First behind-the-scenes pics|last=Rob|date=23 June 2011|work=EastEnders|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=24 June 2011|location=United Kingdom}}</ref> Fatboy is a regular character in ''EastEnders'' since January 2010.
*'''[[Mercy Olubunmi]]''' is portrayed by '''[[Bunmi Mojekwu]]'''. She lives with her grandmother, from whom she is keeping a huge secret. A "good girl", she felt abandoned when her parents moved back to Nigeria.<ref name="cast2"/> She is strong-willed, bound within her faith and motherly, but takes on other people's problems too much.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/scoop/a195871/a-quick-chat-with-mercy-from-enders-e20.html|title=A quick chat with Mercy from 'Enders: E20'|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=12 January 2010|accessdate=12 January 2010}}</ref> She makes a cameo appearance in episode 1 of series 2 and is a regular character in ''EastEnders'' from May 2010 to June 2011.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a318766/eastenders-confirms-mercy-departure.html|title='EastEnders' confirms Mercy departure|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=10 May 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=10 May 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref>
*'''[[Leon Small]]''' is portrayed by '''[[Sam Attwater]]'''. He is a boxer with a lack of respect for authority and is quick to anger, but is also described as effortlessly cool, strong-minded and sexy. His mother died when he was a child and he was left in charge of his alcoholic father, with whom he has a rocky relationship, which Attwater said is the character's weakness.<ref name="cast2"/><ref name="dsleon">{{Cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/scoop/a195884/a-quick-chat-with-leon-from-enders-e20.html|title=A quick chat with Leon from 'Enders: E20'|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=14 January 2010|accessdate=14 January 2010}}</ref> He makes a cameo appearance in episode 1 of series 2 and is a regular character in ''EastEnders'' between January and September 2010.
===Series 2=== *'''[[Asher Levi]]''' is portrayed by '''[[Heshima Thompson]]'''. He is described as charming and sexy with the talent to make him a star.<ref name="Asher profile" /> Thompson described the character as very confident and said that looking after his younger brother Sol has "taken a toll on him."<ref name="Koko" /> He finds it difficult to refuse easy money as his brother and mother complicate things for him.<ref name="series 2 cast" /> Prior to his arrival in the series, he has been recently released from jail for theft,<ref name="Asher profile">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/e20/series2/characters/asher_levi.shtml|title=Asher Levi played by Heshima Thompson|date=29 July 2010|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=29 July 2010}}</ref> but has become a street dancer to keep him away from crime.<ref name="Koko">{{Cite web|url=http://www.kokomagazine.com/?p=1100|title=Eastendersâ E20: Heshima Thompson AKA âAsher Leviâ|date=27 August 2010|work=Koko Magazine|accessdate=27 August 2010}}</ref>
*'''[[Stevie Dickinson]]''' is portrayed by '''Amanda Fairbank-Hynes'''. She is the privately educated<ref name="Press Association Stevie">{{cite news|url=http://uk.news.yahoo.com/21/20100906/ten-unrequited-love-for-e20-s-stevie-5a7c575.html|title=Unrequited love for E20's Stevie|last=Press Association|date=6 September 2010|publisher=[[Yahoo!|Yahoo! News]]|accessdate=8 September 2010 | archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5saY2c8ED | archivedate=8 September 2010}}</ref> daughter of rich parents who have abandoned her to go travelling.<ref name="series 2 cast" /> She is creative, empathetic, quirky, forward, lovely, eccentric, naÃ¯ve and a daydreamer who lacks common sense but has bursts of assertiveness and intelligence.<ref name="Chat with Stevie">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s86/eastenders-e20/scoop/a270513/a-chat-with-stevie-from-eastenders-e20.html|title=A chat with Stevie from 'EastEnders: E20'|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=1 September 2010|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=1 September 2010|location=London}}</ref> Stevie is one of four characters who has an official profile on social networking site Twitter.<ref name="Beehive City">{{Cite web|url=http://www.beehivecity.com/television/eastenders-e20-returns-with-street-dance-twitter-roxanne-mckee18825/|title=Eastenders E20 returns with street dance, Twitter & Roxanne McKee|last=Glanfield|first=Tim|date=11 August 2010|work=Beehive City|publisher=Honeycomb Publishing & Media|accessdate=15 August 2010}}</ref>
*'''[[Naz Mehmet]]''' is portrayed by '''Emaa Hussen'''. She is of Turkish descent and is described as being "torn between two worlds".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.theasiantoday.com/article.aspx?articleId=2132|title=Actress lands first role on Eastenders E20|date=10 August 2010|work=[[The Asian Today]]|publisher=Urban Media|accessdate=17 September 2010|location=Birmingham}}</ref> Hussen described her as a family girl but wants to have fun, and said she is confident, but is also a daddy's girl.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s86/eastenders-e20/scoop/a272588/a-chat-with-naz-from-eastenders-e20.html|title=A chat with Naz from 'EastEnders: E20'|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=4 September 2010|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=6 September 2010|location=London}}</ref> She is the apple of her father's eye and he sees her as a perfect student.<ref name="series 2 cast" /><ref name="Naz profile">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/e20/series2/characters/naz_mehmet.shtml|title=Naz Mehmet played by Emaa Hussen|date=29 July 2010|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=29 July 2010}}</ref> Naz is one of four characters who has an official profile on social networking site Twitter.<ref name="Beehive City" /> Naz also appears in series 3, along with Sol.<ref name="series 3 cast introduced">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s86/eastenders-e20/scoop/a326342/eastenders-e20-ricky-norwood-introduces-the-cast.html|title='EastEnders: E20': Ricky Norwood introduces the cast|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=23 June 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=23 June 2011|location=London}}</ref>
*'''[[Sol Levi]]''' is portrayed by '''[[Tosin Cole]]'''. He is Asher's younger brother and is described as shy and loyal but has a bad temper and hides his feelings with violence.<ref name="series 2 cast">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s86/eastenders-e20/scoop/a252200/more-on-the-new-eastenders-e20-cast.html|title=More on the new 'EastEnders: E20' cast!|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=29 July 2010|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=28 July 2010|location=London}}</ref><ref name="Sol profile">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/e20/series2/characters/sol_levi.shtml|title=Solomon Levi played by Tosin Cole|date=29 July 2010|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=29 July 2010}}</ref> Cole described him as thoughtful, soft, easily hurt and dependent,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s86/eastenders-e20/scoop/a271969/a-chat-with-solomon-from-eastenders-e20.html|title=A chat with Solomon from 'EastEnders: E20'|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=3 September 2010|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=3 September 2010|location=London}}</ref> and said he is reserved, finds it difficult to function without Asher and likes his family to be together.<ref name="meet the boys">{{cite web|url=http://tv.sky.com/eastenders-e20-meet-the-boys|title=EastEnders E20: Meet The Boys|date=August 2010|publisher=[[British Sky Broadcasting|Sky.com]]|accessdate=8 September 2010|format=video}}</ref> Asher has looked after Sol all his life and as a result, Sol finds it difficult to establish his own identity.<ref name="series 2 cast"/> Sol also appears in series 3, along with Naz.<ref name="series 3 cast introduced" />
===Series 3=== *{{Anchor|Faith Olubunmi}}'''[[Faith Olubunmi]]'''<ref name="meet the cast"/> is portrayed by '''Modupe Adeyeye'''. She is Mercy's younger sister, who was sent to Nigeria by their grandmother "to get back on the straight and narrow, but she is back and worse than ever!" She is described as someone who can be "an incredible amount of fun and excitement, and she has a cheekiness that charms most people. But she's not nearly as bright as she thinks she isâshe can sometimes be reckless and downright dangerous. When Faith runs into Donnie and Ava, she sees it as her chance to cause even more mischief!"<ref name="Series 3 characters" /> Faith also has a profile on Twitter.<ref name="About series 3">{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p00k0bg4/features/about|title=About Series 3|work=EastEnders: E20|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=13 September 2011}}</ref>
*{{Anchor|Donnie Lester}}'''Donnie Lester'''<ref name="meet the cast"/> is portrayed by '''[[Samuell Benta]]'''. His mother is absent from his life and his father is in prison, meaning he has spent a lot of time in care. He is described as "a boy of few words, but it'd be a mistake to get on the wrong side of him as he's got a temper. All Donnie wants is to get out of the system and look after his little sister Riley. However, when he meets Ava, something inside him changesâsuddenly Riley isn't the only one he wants to care for..."<ref name="Series 3 characters" />
*{{anchor|Ava Bourne}}'''Ava Bourne'''<ref name="meet the cast">{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/e20/about/series_three_cast.shtml|title=Series 3: Meet the cast|work=EastEnders: E20|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=25 June 2011}}</ref> is portrayed by '''Sophie Colquhoun'''. She is described as "a closed book [who] can look after herself." She has spent time in care, but because she comes across as certain, definite and hard, people think she is stuck up. She has a cool and brittle faÃ§ade, but has a secret past which she is constantly trying to get away from.<ref name="Series 3 characters">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s86/eastenders-e20/scoop/a326288/eastenders-e20-guide-to-the-new-characters.html|title='EastEnders: E20': Guide to the new characters|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=23 June 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=23 June 2011|location=London}}</ref> In the series is it revealed that her real name is Olivia Bryan and she was involved in an arson attack on a house she thought was empty. She is also raped by her keyworker, Richard.
==Recurring characters and ''EastEnders'' character cameos== <!-- all characters are listed in order of appearance -->
===Introduced in series 1=== *'''Andy''' ([[Stephen North|Steve North]])<ref name="about">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/e20/about/index-series1.shtml|title=About series 1|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=29 July 2010}}</ref><ref name="characters">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/e20/characters/index-series1.shtml|title=Characters from Series 1|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=29 July 2010}}</ref>{{Anchor|Andy}} â Zsa Zsa's stepfather. In episode 1 he chases after Zsa Zsa and assumes she is inside 89b George Street. He shouts that he wants his money and dumps her belongings in the street, dropping his satellite navigation system. Lucy points out where Zsa Zsa is hiding, so Andy chases after her again. He is beaten up by Leon, allowing Zsa Zsa to get away. Returning to his car, he realises his sat nav has gone. When he sees Zsa Zsa, Leon, Mercy and Fatboy, he chases them in his car as they run into 89b George Street, and demands his sat nav back, which Fatboy found. Zsa Zsa throws it out of the window and tell Andy to leave.
[[File:Nina Wadia.jpg|thumb|140px|Nina Wadia appears as Zainab Masood in series 1, 2 and 3.]] *'''[[Zainab Masood]]''' ([[Nina Wadia]])<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /> â Zainab appears in episode 1 when Zsa Zsa runs past her, then Andy, who is chasing Zsa Zsa, runs into her. She also appears in series 2,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/images/208501/|title=Wadia looking at?|year=2010|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=10 August 2010}}</ref> where in episode 3, she attends a dance class run by Roger, but assumes Asher is Roger as Roger is late. When Roger arrives, Asher runs off with the money and Zainab finds him, telling him to keep the money but advising him to stick to dancing rather than stealing. In series 3,<ref name="meet the cast" /> Zainab is against a hostel being in her neighbourhood, and forces Faith, Donnie and Ava to clean up after two of them cause mayhem across Albert Square.
*'''Benjamin''' (Damien Lynch)<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" />{{Anchor|Benjamin}} â The church's youth minister who works with Mercy on her project to bring younger people to the church. In episode 1 he is disappointed when Fatboy shows his website plans. In episode 2 Fatboy greets him and his wife Celia in the church, and in episode 3 he visits Mercy in the cafÃ© and says her grandmother is worried about her spending so much time with her new friends. She then asks him to lend her Â£20. In episode 8 he speaks to Mercy about her project. Fatboy speaks to him about Mercy being in trouble, which Benjamin thinks means she has a new boyfriend. Later, Mercy tells him she is pregnant by him. In episode 10, he approaches Mercy saying they need to talk, but she sends him away. When Mercy suffers a miscarriage, Fatboy brings Benjamin to the flat but Mercy is already on her way to the hospital. At the hospital in episode 11, Benjamin tells Mercy it worked out for the best, leaving her annoyed. He tells her not to worry about the website as she has been through a lot.
*'''[[Lucas Johnson]]''' ([[Don Gilet]])<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /> â Lucas holds services and Bible classes at the Community Centre in episodes 1 and 2.
*'''[[Lucy Beale]]''' ([[Melissa Suffield]])<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /> â In episode 1 Lucy is in 89b George Street with Leon. They kiss passionately until they are interrupted by Andy looking for Zsa Zsa. Lucy points out where Zsa Zsa is, upsetting Leon, who says they are over. In episode 2, the gang attempt to steal Lucy's keys by pretending that Mercy is drunk so that Lucy drops her bag, which Zsa Zsa returns when Lucy is in the cafÃ©'s toilet. Zsa Zsa tells Lucy she hates her.
[[File:Laila Morse.jpg|thumb|100px|Laila Morse appears as her regular ''EastEnders'' character, Mo Harris.]] *'''Celia''' (Marsha Henry)<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /> â Benjamin's wife, who appears alongside him at the church in episodes 1 and 2.
*'''[[Mo Harris]]''' ([[Laila Morse]])<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /> â In episode 1, Fatboy attempts to sell Mo items he found on the street that actually belong to Zsa Zsa, and she is interested until Fatboy offers her an old toy. In episode 12, she sees Fatboy, Zsa Zsa and Leon leaving [[Albert Square]] in a milk float they have stolen.
*'''[[Masood Ahmed]]''' ([[Nitin Ganatra]])<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /> â In episode 1, Masood appears when Fatboy attempts to sell him Zsa Zsa's belongings that he found but he leaves when Leon interrupts. Masood also appears in series 2.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/images/208415/|title=Meeting Masood|year=2010|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=10 August 2010}}</ref> In episode 2, he is on the tube clutching his rucksack and Stevie suspects he is a terrorist, and tells him that love can heal his pain but Naz pulls her away. Later, a drunken Stevie apologises and when Masood notices she is cold and wet, he offers her his coat. In episode 4, Stevie returns the coat to Masood while he is working on the market and she attempts to flirt, however, it is a disaster. After Naz gives her tips, she goes back and flirts again, and asks if Masood has any work going. He asks her to come back tomorrow and Stevie thinks her flirting was successful so goes over the top and flashes him her bra. In episode 6 he comes out during the power cut and asks why Stevie's is the only flat with electricity. In episode 10, Stevie tells him that one day they will have tea together and kisses him before running off. In episode 1 of series 3, Masood gives Ava free food when she tells him she has been mugged, though it is a lie.
*'''[[Heather Trott]]''' ([[Cheryl Fergison]])<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /> â Zsa Zsa runs into Heather in episode 2 and recognises her baby son George from a photo. In episode three, Zsa Zsa visits Heather in the launderette and steals Heather's purse while she is on the telephone. Leon goes into the launderette, stripping to his boxer shorts and leaving Heather embarrassed. Heather realises her purse is missing but Zsa Zsa returns it, saying she found it on the street. In episode 6, Heather asks Zsa Zsa to babysit George. In episode 9, she suggests that Zsa Zsa go back to stay with her mother after Shirley asks her to go home. She also appears in series 2,<ref name="Koko" /> where in episode 3, Asher and Sol go into the launderette and she thinks they are going to rob her.
*'''[[George Trott]]'''<ref name="episode 2">{{Cite episode |title= Episode 2|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/e20/episodes/episode_2.shtml |series=EastEnders: E20 |credits= |network= [[BBC]]|station=[[BBC Online]] |airdate=9 January 2010 }}</ref> (uncredited) â Heather's baby. He appears in episodes 2, 5 and 6.
*'''[[Jane Beale]]''' ([[Laurie Brett]])<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /> â In episode 2, Jane is working in the cafÃ© where Fatboy attempts to chat her up. She also appears in series 2.<ref name="Koko" /> In episode 3 she is seen briefly talking to a girl outside the cafÃ©, and in episode 8 she confronts Asher about some trainers he sold to her step son. He says he does not give refunds so she snatches his wallet and takes some money out but he snatches it back. Jane tells PC Adams and his colleague that Asher is a thief and they chase after him. In episode 10, Asher tells Jane he will refund her, and when Sol calls him, she lets him go.
*'''Malcolm Small''' ([[Paul Trussel]])<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" />{{Anchor|Malcolm Small}} â Leon's alcoholic father who kicked him out before the start of the series. He phones Leon in episode 3 and Leon says he could be charged with [[grievous bodily harm]]. He first appears in episode 4 when he leaves the police station and phones Leon, but Leon does not answer. He interrupts Leon's training session at the community centre and asks for his money back. Leon does not know what he means but they go back to the flat and Malcolm punches Leon, taking the money Leon and his friends have saved. In episode 5, Leon gets a call to say Malcolm is in hospital. In episode 9, Leon visits him but he has discharged himself, and does not answer his phone.
*'''Coach Roberts''' (Grant Davis)<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /> â Leon's boxing coach. He appears during episode 4 while Leon is training and attends Leon's boxing match in episode 12. Zsa Zsa turns up late and Coach Roberts tells her was missed his fight and he has gone.
[[File:Adam Woodyatt.jpg|thumb|100px|Adam Woodyatt appears as Ian Beale in two episodes.]] *'''[[Ian Beale]]''' ([[Adam Woodyatt]])<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /> â In episode 4, Fatboy and Mercy ask Ian for patties in his chip shop, and Fatboy accuses him of racism. He shows a potential tenant around 89b George Street while Zsa Zsa and Leon are hiding in a wardrobe, and Ian inadvertently locks them in it. In episode 12, he sees a party going on at 89b George Street and attempts to stop it. When the police arrive, they ask if it is his flat and when he confirms it, he looks worried that they will arrest him.
*'''Nurse Warren''' (Rhiannon Harper-Rafferty)<ref name="about" /> â A nurse who Mercy consults about abortion in episode 5. She also appears in episode 9 of series 2, where she is caring for Sol and Asher's mother Caroline.
*'''[[Shirley Carter]]''' ([[Linda Henry]])<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /> â Zsa Zsa's aunt. In episode 5, she sees Zsa Zsa and tells her to leave as there is nothing for her there. In episode 7, Shirley answers the door to Leon and tells him Zsa Zsa's father is dead, as Zsa Zsa said she is visiting him. In episode 9, she pays Zsa Zsa to leave. In episode 11, Leon goes to Shirley's house looking for Zsa Zsa, but Shirley says Zsa Zsa has probably left Walford. In episode 12, Zsa Zsa runs past Shirley who tells Zsa Zsa she is going in the wrong direction, and Zsa Zsa returns the money Shirley paid her.
*'''[[Tamwar Masood]]''' ([[Himesh Patel]])<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /> â Tamwar is seen in episode 8 when Mercy asks him for help with her project. Later, Fatboy sees them talking and accuses Tamwar of sleeping with Mercy and getting her pregnant. Tamwar also appears in series 2, where in episode 3, he delivers a curry to Stevie but finds her waiting in bed as she was expecting his father Masood who she had an erotic dream about. Tamwar takes the curry back when Stevie is unable to pay. In episode 5, Naz flirts with Tamwar, then asks if he would give her some food for free, saying if he does, one day he can touch her breasts.
*'''[[Grace Olubunmi]]''' (Jay Byrd in series 1, [[Ellen Thomas (actress)|Ellen Thomas]] in series 3)<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /><ref name="series 3 behind scenes"/> â Mercy's grandmother, who is credited in series 1 as Mrs Olubunmi. She will fund Mercy's college education if her church project is successful. Mercy phones her in episode 1 to say she is not coming home, and in episode 2 Mercy has 12 missed calls from her, as she is upset about Fatboy's website design for the project. Mercy speaks to her and then Fatboy tells her everything will be fine. She appears in episode 8 at the community centre, saying she has barely seen Mercy in the past week, that Fatboy is a bad influence on her and that Mercy thinks she is grown up but she is just a child. She reappears in ''EastEnders'' following Mercy's transition into the main show, played by Ellen Thomas. Thomas also appears as Grace in series 3, along with her granddaughter Faith,<ref name="series 3 behind scenes"/> where, in episode 1, she ejects Faith from her home, forcing her to squat in 3 Albert Square. <!-- *'''Nina Burton'''<ref name="Episode 3 BBC Programmes">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00sbk16|title=E20: Episode 3|publisher=[[BBC Programmes]] ([[BBC]])|accessdate=4 May 2010}}</ref> (Eloise Joseph)<ref name="about" /> â The hospital receptionist who, in episode 9, tells Leon that his father discharged himself from hospital. --> [[File:Rudolph Walker.jpg|thumb|100px|Rudolph Walker makes cameo appearances as Patrick Trueman.]] *'''[[Patrick Trueman]]''' ([[Rudolph Walker]])<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /> â Fatboy convinces Patrick to sell him alcohol from his shop, the Minute Mart, despite having no identification. He also appears in series 2,<ref name="Koko" /> where in episode 3, Stevie attempts to buy drinks from the shop but her payment card is declined. In episode 5, Naz goes to the shop asking for products that Patrick does not sell, and he asks her not to shop there any more. She later asks if he has seen Stevie.
*'''[[Libby Fox]]''' ([[Belinda Owusu]])<ref name="about" /><ref name="characters" /> â In episode 9, Fatboy sees Libby walking down the street and makes up a story about her.
===Introduced in series 2=== *'''Caroline Levi''' (Sandra Yaw)<ref name="series 2 characters" /><ref name="series 2 cast and crew" />{{Anchor|Caroline Levi}} â Asher and Sol's mother, who throws Asher out in episode 1, threatening to kill him and Sol. In episode 7, Sol returns home but discovers from a neighbour that Caroline has been taken away, though the neighbour does not know where. In episode 9, Sol is with her in hospital, after she was picked up by police in the middle of the road with no shoes, though she is unconscious. It is revealed she is schizophrenic. In episode 10 she is conscious but still in hospital.
*'''Olly Manthrope-Hall''' ([[Joshua McGuire]])<ref name="series 2 characters" /><ref name="series 2 cast and crew" />{{Anchor|Olly Manthrope-Hall}} â Stevie's boyfriend. Olly has a profile on social networking site Twitter revealing that he is already living in Walford with Stevie prior to the start of the series and he enjoys cycling.<ref name="Beehive City"/><ref name="PAtwitter">{{cite news|url=http://tv.uk.msn.com/news/articles.aspx?cp-documentid=154378862|title=New E20 series previews on Twitter|last=Press Association|date=12 August 2010|publisher=[[MSN]]|accessdate=17 October 2010|archivedate=17 October 2010|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5tXGr37gJ}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://twitter.com/OllyManHall|title=Olly Manthrope-Hall on Twitter|publisher=Twitter|accessdate=15 August 2010}}</ref> Further posts show that he went out on their anniversary and she hoped to make the relationship work but he hinted that he would end it. In episode 1, he ends his relationship with Stevie after they have sex and in episode 2 he goes to the flat asking Stevie for the rent money. In episode 4 he returns to the flat to take some of the furniture as his new flat is unfurnished. In episode 7 he barges in saying he will have to let the flat go as he needs his deposit, but Stevie asks for one more day. In episode 8 he goes to the flat and Stevie hands him the money but he says he has given notice anyway and they have one more day before moving out. In episode 9, he calls and texts Stevie but she ignores him until later when she invites him to the flat. When he arrives, he says he has ended his relationship with Pippa and wants Stevie back. She blindfolds him and handcuffs him naked to a chair, then makes him wear a dress so he has to go home in it.
*'''[[Billy Mitchell (EastEnders)|Billy Mitchell]]''' ([[Perry Fenwick]])<ref name="series 2 characters" /><ref name="series 2 cast and crew" /> â In episode 1, Billy is angered when his fruit and veg is knocked over twice, and calls the police. In episode 7 he witnesses a fight between Asher and Sol in front of his stall.
*'''PC Adams''' (Andrew Watson)<ref name="series 2 cast and crew">{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/e20/series2/characters/fullcastandcrew.shtml|title=Full cast and crew|date=September 2010|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=8 September 2010}}</ref> â A police officer who speaks to Sol and Billy in episode 1 after Billy calls them about his stock being knocked over. In episode 8 he and his colleague chase after Asher when Jane tells them he is a thief, and they later stop Sol asking if he knows where Asher is.
*'''Mr Mehmet'''{{Anchor|Mr Mehmet}}<ref name="Omnibus 2" /> (Nayeef Rashed)<ref name="series 2 characters" /><ref name="series 2 cast and crew" /> â Naz's father. In episode 1, she hears him shouting through the front door and in episode 3, she goes home to her parents' where it is revealed that Naz and Ekin are to be married. In episode 9, after Naz has packed to visit Turkey with Ekin, he finds she has escaped through a window. In episode 9, he and Ekin drive to Walford to find Naz and take her to the car, but Sol stops it and Naz gets out and kisses him. Later, Mr Mehmet is happy for her and they hug.
*'''Ekin Beg'''<ref name="Episode 1 Omnibus" /> (Hemi Yeroham)<ref name="series 2 characters">{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/e20/characters/|title=Characters from Series 2|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=7 September 2010}}</ref><ref name="series 2 cast and crew" />{{anchor|Ekin Beg}} â A taxi driver who Naz avoids in episode 2, but in episode 3 he finds her and takes her home where it is revealed they are to be married. In episode 4 he goes to Stevie's flat and reveals to Naz's friends that he and Naz are engaged. In episode 5, Asher meets Ekin to tell him to stay away from Naz as she is seeing someone. Ekin later returns to Walford and asks Sol to pass on a message that Asher is not Naz's boyfriend and he should stick to his own kind. He appears in episode 9 with Naz and her parents before they are due to travel to Turkey to meet his parents. Naz escapes through a window and in episode 10, Ekin and Mr Mehmet drive to Walford to find Naz and take her to the car, but Sol stops it and Naz gets out and kisses him.
[[File:Flawless (dance group).jpg|thumb|150px|Marlon Wallen appears as himself along with the rest of his dance group, Flawless.]] *'''Marlon Wallen''' (himself){{Anchor|Marlon Wallen}}<ref name="series 2 characters" /><ref name="series 2 cast and crew" /> â Marlon and Skolla are in charge of the dance auditions attended by Fatboy, Asher and Sol. Marlon appears in episode 1 and again in episode 10 where he allows Sol to perform solo at the dance-off, and later performs with the rest of his dance group, [[Flawless (dance group)|Flawless]].
*'''Skolla''' (Tony Adigun)<ref name="series 2 characters" /><ref name="series 2 cast and crew" />{{Anchor|Skolla}} â Marlon and Skolla are in charge of the dance auditions attended by Fatboy, Asher and Sol. Skolla accepts a bribe from Asher in episode 1 to allow Sol through. In episode 5, the crew dance at callbacks but Skolla tells Sol he is too slow and asks him to do the routine solo. Sol is put off by the audience and leaves, and Asher assures Skolla that Sol is a good dancer. In episode 7, Asher turns up late for rehearsals so Skolla asks him to leave. When a fight breaks out between Asher and Sol, Skolla helps to break it up and says he wants neither of them back, revealing that Asher bought Sol's place. In episode 10, Skolla and the rest of the dance crew perform at the dance-off.
*'''Araminta''' (Arabella Langley)<ref name="series 2 cast and crew" /><ref name="Episode 1 Omnibus">{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00tdxjw|title=Episode 1 Omnibus|publisher=[[BBC Programmes]]|accessdate=8 September 2010}}</ref>{{Anchor|Araminta}} â In episode 2, Araminta has a birthday party where Stevie says she is making her boyfriend wait for sex. She dances with Asher, and they end up having sex. Afterwards, she invites him to a club night later in the week and they are interrupted by her boyfriend.
*'''Pippa''' ([[Roxanne McKee]])<ref name="series 2 characters" /><ref name="series 2 cast and crew" />{{Anchor|Pippa}} â Olly's new girlfriend. She is described as rich, attractive and sophisticated. McKee said she was "excited and proud to be part of this production."<ref>{{cite press release|title=EastEnders: E20 welcomes four new faces to the Square|publisher=[[BBC|BBC Press Office]]|date=29 July 2010|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/pressoffice/pressreleases/stories/2010/07_july/29/e20.shtml|accessdate=6 September 2010}}</ref> Mckee described the character to [[Digital Spy]] as generous and "always out for a good time", and said that Pippa's main role in the series is to drive Stevie's story forward.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s86/eastenders-e20/scoop/a273984/roxanne-mckee-chats-eastenders-e20.html|title=Roxanne McKee chats 'EastEnders: E20'|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=8 September 2010|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=8 September 2010|location=London}}</ref> Pippa appears in episode 2 at Araminta's party, where Stevie badmouths her ex-boyfriend Olly, but Pippa introduces Olly as her new boyfriend. Stevie insults Pippa, who pushes her into the punch bowl. In episode 6, Stevie and Pippa bump into each other in a club and become friendly. In episode 7, they wake up in bed together, and she hears Olly when he comes in. She calls Olly a pig and helps Stevie by writing her a cheque for Olly's deposit. She tells Stevie she is one of the sexiest girls she has ever met and asks her to call her before leaving. In episode 9, Olly tells Stevie he has ended his relationship with Pippa. <!-- *'''Roger''' (Eddie Elliott)<ref name="series 2 cast and crew" /><ref name="Omnibus 2" /> â The teacher of a dance class at the community centre in episode 3. He arrives late and Asher takes the class in his place pretending to be him, and when he is found out, Asher runs off with the money. --> [[File:Derek Martin.jpg|thumb|100px|Derek Martin plays Charlie Slater.]] *'''Mrs Mehmet'''{{Anchor|Mrs Mehmet}}<ref name="Omnibus 2">{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00tvz9n|title=Omnibus 2|publisher=[[BBC Programmes]]|accessdate=14 September 2010}}</ref> (Myriam Acharki)<ref name="series 2 characters" /><ref name="series 2 cast and crew" /> â Naz's mother who appears in episode 3 and again in episode 9, where Naz asks her if she ever had a dream when she was Naz's age. She says her dream was to marry Naz's father, but later tells Naz she wanted to be a hairdresser.
*'''[[Charlie Slater]]''' ([[Derek Martin]])<ref name="series 2 characters" /><ref name="series 2 cast and crew" /> â In episode 6, Charlie is having his dinner in front of the television when the electricity goes off, caused by Sol and Stevie.
*'''[[Whitney Dean]]''' ([[Shona McGarty]])<ref name="series 2 characters" /><ref name="series 2 cast and crew" /> â Whitney appears in episode 8 when Asher sells her a pair of trainers, however, she returns them saying they are different sizes. He says he cannot refund her so Jane, who has had a similar experience, snatches his wallet and takes some money, but Asher snatches it back and runs off.
*'''[[Roxy Mitchell]]''' ([[Rita Simons]])<ref name="series 2 characters" /><ref name="series 2 cast and crew" /> â Roxy appears in episode 9 when Stevie is due to leave the flat. Stevie asks to stay and tells Roxy she will go to the council about all the safety violations she has found, so Roxy allows her to stay.
*'''[[Ace and Vis|DJ Ace]]''' (himself)<ref name="series 2 characters" /><ref name="series 2 cast and crew" /> â DJ Ace DJs at the dance-off in episode 10.
===Introduced in series 3=== *'''[[Dot Branning]]''' ([[June Brown]])<ref name="meet the cast" /><ref name="s3e1"/> â Dot is seen with Fatboy in episode 1 when Faith asks if she can stay with them. She is also seen in episode 13, she is seen in the choir when she goes to 3 Albert Square, Teressa opens the door and she asks her if Faith, Donnie and Ava would want to join the choir.
*'''[[Jack Branning]]''' ([[Scott Maslen]])<ref name="s3e1">{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p00k0bg7|title=Episode 1|work=EastEnders: E20|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=22 September 2011}}</ref> â When Faith sees Jack in episode 1, she accuses him of eyeing her up.
*'''[[Janine Butcher|Janine Malloy]]''' ([[Charlie Brooks]])<ref name="s3e1"/> â In episode 2, Donnie runs into Janine after stealing from a shop, causing him to fall over. She later finds him, Ava and Faith in 3 Albert Square where they are squatting, and threatens to tell the police when they start a scam.
*'''[[Kim Fox]]''' ([[Tameka Empson]])<ref name="s3e2">{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p00k0bqr|title=Epsiode 3|work=EastEnders: E20|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=22 September 2011}}</ref> â Donnie steals from Kim in episode 2 and she runs after him, but struggles in her shoes. When he says he thought she was the kind of person who would help someone in need, she lets him go.
*'''Richard Vance''' (Sam Phillips) â A care worker who has come from university and is described as someone who is "filled with plenty of trendy attitudes towards care. On the surface he's terrific, if occasionally a little condescending. Although he talks the talk, he thinks of the kids in care as either good or badâand he thinks the bad ones are not worth the effort. He takes a shine to Ava when he meets her, but Richard has a sinister side to him and will go to any lengths to get what he wants..."<ref name="Series 3 characters" />
*'''Riley''' (Eliza Newman) â Donnie's 14-year-old sister, who has lived in care since the age of 6. She is described as someone who "knows how the care system works but she hates it. She's moved to a new care home but is getting badly bullied. She turns to Donnie for help but things don't go to plan, leaving them both in a horrifying situation..."<ref name="Series 3 characters" />
*'''[[Phil Mitchell]]''' ([[Steve McFadden]])<ref name="meet the cast" />
*'''[[Anthony Moon]]''' (Matt Lapinskas)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a330833/matt-lapinskas-i-was-nervous-over-eastenders-debut.html|title=Matt Lapinskas: 'I was nervous over EastEnders debut'|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=20 July 2011|first=Daniel|last=Kilkelly|}}</ref>
